sub_title: Social Development| Community Development, Stakeholder Engagement, Education
summary:
As the Managing Director of Socialab, a vibrant organization that supports and incubates social ventures that address the most pressing challenges in Latin America and the Caribbean, I have over 15 years of experience in the development sector. My passion and vision drive me to foster social innovation and social development across the region, collaborating with diverse stakeholders and partners to create and scale sustainable solutions.

My core competencies include research, strategic planning, operations management, stakeholder engagement, fundraising, data analysis, and reporting. I leverage these skills to design, develop, and execute comprehensive business plans that align with the organization's vision and goals. I also oversee the daily operations, ensuring fiscal planning, compliance monitoring, and personnel management. Furthermore, I facilitate open communication and timely reporting to the board, clients, and funders, ensuring transparency and accountability. Through my leadership and vision, I have contributed to the growth and success of Socialab and its initiatives, such as conducting impactful consultancies for prestigious entities, conducting critical research and social diagnosis, and leveraging analytical expertise to extract profound insights.

school.name: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam

profile_positions.description: As a co-founder and board member at DYR, I've driven our mission to use fashion, design, and communication for social transformation. Together with our dedicated team, I've led strategies for conscious, ethical practices in production, consumption, and lifestyles, aiming for a more inclusive, equal, and harmonious world. We've cultivated partnerships, engaged stakeholders, and fostered collaborations to amplify our global impact, establishing DYR as a force for positive change. As board members, we're shaping a more conscious, compassionate, and sustainable future.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder and board member

company.name: Socialab: Instituto para América Latina y el Caribe

profile_positions.company: Socialab: Instituto para América Latina y el Caribe
profile_positions.description: As Managing Director, I've been instrumental in shaping and advancing our organization's mission. My achievements include designing and executing strategic plans for growth and operational efficiency, leading impactful consultancies for prestigious entities like the International Labor Organization (ILO) and Federación Nacional de Trabajadores de la Agroindustria, Gastronomía, Hotelería y Afines (FENTRAGH), conducting critical research on labor conditions and social change, leveraging analytical expertise for evidence-based practices, meticulous daily operations management, adept leadership, and collaborative board engagement for comprehensive mission-aligned business plans, and ensuring transparency through various report deliveries. My dedication to strategic planning, data-driven decisions, and transparent reporting has been instrumental in driving our organization's continuous growth and impact, particularly in advancing knowledge and addressing critical workforce issues.
profile_positions.title: Manangin Director

profile_positions.description: As the Administrative Director of a small educational system, I've overseen critical operational functions like fiscal planning, compliance monitoring, and personnel management, ensuring our organization's smooth operation. My commitment to transparent communication and timely reporting has supported our board's effectiveness. I've focused on staff development and motivation, optimizing teaching efficiency through meticulous organization and supply management, contributing to our team's success. I've also engaged stakeholders to boost our profile and drive expansion, while my dedication to guest relations has enhanced our reputation. In my role as Administrative Director, I've remained dedicated to our educational system's overall success
profile_positions.title: Administrative Director

company.name: Dra. Lupita Chaves Cervantes - Costa Rica

profile_positions.company: Dra. Lupita Chaves Cervantes - Costa Rica
profile_positions.description:
As a member of a multidisciplinary consultant team, contributed to the design of a Gender and Justice Study Program for Postgraduate Judicial Operators in collaboration with the Organization of American States (OAS).
Developed expertise in analyzing political policies, legislation, and government operations related to gender issues in Costa Rica and Central America. Provided insightful forecasts of political, economic, and social gender trends based on evolving conditions and political acumen.
Streamlined administrative processes, managing schedules and correspondence to ensure efficient productivity.
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Authored a successful grant proposal for the Funding Leadership and Opportunities for Women 2016-2020, funded by the United States Embassy. Led initiatives focused on preventing sexual trafficking, providing assistance to undocumented migrants, and promoting women's rights.
Implemented capacity building strategies for resource mobilization. Orchestrated a donation campaign to support victims of trafficking. Facilitated seamless onboarding processes for new hires, including comprehensive training and creating/updating PowerPoint presentations.
Identified opportunities for operational and financial improvements by analyzing and synthesizing data, generating actionable insights. Participated in international trips to support negotiations and launch new projects in Spain and the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Successfully developed national and international strategic fundraising initiatives, securing over 1.7 million dollars in funding over a two-year period, addressing critical needs within vulnerable communities.
Oversaw the management of the Global Village international volunteer program, coordinating the participation of 900 volunteers annually.
Implemented integrated public relations strategies, aligning advertising efforts to create cohesive and multifaceted approaches. Identified effective communication methods to engage target audiences, generated public interest through special events, sponsorships, and launch parties.
 Represented HFHCR through domestic and international travel, visiting rural areas in Costa Rica, Nicaragua, the Dominican Republic, Colombia, and the USA. Coordinated necessary meetings and prepared agendas for international trips.
profile_positions.title: Resource Development Director

profile_positions.description:
Effectively classified returned products for all of Crocs' e-commerce franchises in the European Union, ensuring accurate inventory management and customer satisfaction.
Monitored problem tickets and provided technical support using a designated help desk system. Expertly processed refunds, exchanges, and company credits to address customer concerns, including incorrect orders and delivery tracking issues. Demonstrated proficiency in resolving conflicts and offering personalized solutions to regain customer loyalty.
profile_positions.title: Administrator of E-Commerce

skills: management, stakeholder relation development, fundraising, non-profit.
